channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: New details have emerged of Addin Fonua-Blake's referee abuse following Manly's controversial loss to Newcastle on Sunday.
item.title: 'That is intolerable': V'landys fumes as second Fonua-Blake spray at ref is revealed

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The NSW-Victoria border will close at 12.01 tomorrow. A travel ban is already in place for residents of Melbourne.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: NSW-Victoria border to close midnight tomorrow as North Melbourne public housing residents criticise lockdown conditions

item.description: Hisham al-Hashimi, who advised the US-led coalition in fighting terror, had recently received threats from Iran-backed militias in Iraq.
item.title: Iraqi terrorism expert shot dead outside home

item.description: When the kids complain, instead of telling them what to do, share your experience and let them decide.
item.title: Tricks to combat the dreaded school holiday 'I'm bored'

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Anthony Eisen and Nicholas Molnar are selling $250m in shares as the company looks to speed up its global expansion with a $1b capital raise.
item.title: Afterpay founders in $250m sell-off as company announces $1b capital raise

item.description: The Sussexes use their final appearance as working members of the Royal family to address the 'historical injustice' of colonial Britain.
item.title: Commonwealth must acknowledge racist past: Harry and Meghan

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Tired, angry and fed up, players then had to return home after midnight to try to salvage some rest and sleep.
item.title: A-League teams left on the tarmac in attempt to leave before border closure

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 7, 2020

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: The Australian sharemarket shot out the gate on Tuesday, pushing COVID-19 worries aside and chasing Wall Street's overnight surge.
item.title: ASX shakes pandemic jitters with 1% rise; RBA meeting ahead

item.description: Some investment firms, including those that run hedge funds or manage money for wealthy investors, are among the businesses approved for emergency US government loans.
item.title: Wall Street firms scored emergency government loans amid pandemic

item.description: Security forces have overriding authority to enter and search properties, and to stop people under investigation from leaving the city.
item.title: New details emerge on Hong Kong security law as first person charged denied bail

item.description: Federal officials failed to carry out a complete analysis of the environmental impacts of the controversial project, the federal judge ruled.
item.title: In a win for activists, US judge orders shutdown of Dakota Access pipeline

item.description: Central banks and governments have poured trillions into the ravaged global economy, but even so, the world is still suffering its worst economic crisis since the Great Depression and faces an uncertain road to recovery..
item.title: The world economy took the express elevator down, now it faces steep stairs back up

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: With a country divided into those states that have eliminated community spread and those that have not, calls to reopen the nation could send the more fortunate states back into a suppression model.
item.title: Could opening WA’s border mean losing some of our freedoms?

item.description: What happened overnight and what is ahead for the Australian sharemarket.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX set for gains as China optimism drives markets higher; RBA on tap

item.description: The man who guided the Kansas City Chiefs to a Super Bowl this year is about to throw shade on the previous biggest deal in NFL history.
item.title: Patrick Mahomes played NFL for $2.8m this year. His new contract is worth $450m

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Tai Wesley had plenty more to give professional basketball but the much-loved NBL power forward has opted against taking his family back to Australia amid the COVID-19 pandemic, so has retired.
item.title: NBL star Tai Wesley announces shock retirement

item.description: Tottenham duo Hugo Lloris and Son Heung-min had to be separated by teammates during a confrontation at halftime of a 1-0 victory over Everton in the English Premier League.
item.title: Spurs captain Lloris confronts Son during 1-0 win over Everton

item.description: A New York district attorney has charged Amy Cooper with filing a false police report after she falsely claimed an African-American man was threatening her life.
item.title: White woman who called 911 on black man in Central Park charged

item.description: After Donald Trump's brother unsuccessfully tried to block the book's publication, Simon & Schuster has brought its release date forward, citing 'high demand and extraordinary interest'.
item.title: Mary Trump's explosive book on the President gets early release

item.description: Amazon crosses the $US3000 a share mark while Wall Street is boosted on a rebound in US services industry activity in June and expectations of a revival in China's economy.
item.title: ASX set to rise as Wall Street jumps; Amazon shares hit record high

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: The 28-year-old man allegedly fled the scene after shooting Robert Atkinson, 44, in the garage of his Wentworthville home.
item.title: Man charged with murder after 'targeted' shooting in Sydney's west

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Huawei has lost the anglosphere. The telecommunications giant that symbolised China's economic rise will no longer build 5G networks across Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United States and now Britain.
item.title: How the US steamrolled Chinese tech giant out of Five Eyes

item.description: Warren Buffett built his reputation as an investor able to swoop in during volatile markets to strike unique and complicated deals in past crises. Now he has pounced again.
item.title: Crisis investor: Warren Buffett ends drought with $14.3b energy bet

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Not one organisation or person from China is yet on the list of people and organisations that Britain's new human rights legislation will target.
item.title: British MPs want Hong Kong's Carrie Lam on Magnitsky hit list

item.description: Uber has announced it has acquired Postmates for $US2.65 billion to expand its food delivery market share and significantly increase the business of supplying everyday goods.
item.title: Uber buys rival for $3.8b as it makes 'everyday' delivery push

item.dc:creator: Sam Downing
item.description: The prime reason anyone should exercise is to feel better — to get stronger, fitter, healthier. As a result, you might even end up looking pretty decent too.
item.title: The difference between training for aesthetics and for health

item.dc:creator: Farrah Tomazin
item.description: The US President has been criticised for suggesting that 99 per cent of coronavirus cases are "totally harmless" as the rate of infection soars across the nation.
item.title: Trump under fire as US coronavirus deaths surpass 130,000

item.description: The US President appeared to urge NASCAR driver Bubba Wallace to apologise over an incident involving a noose found in the racecar driver's garage last month, calling it a "hoax".
item.title: Trump suggests NASCAR driver Bubba Wallace should apologise for noose 'hoax'

item.description: More than 200 scientists say there is evidence the virus could be spread by tiny particles in the air, causing the WHO to review their concerns.
item.title: WHO reviewing scientists' concerns over airborne spread of COVID-19

item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's long-time confidante has been transferred to a Brooklyn prison known for its problems, facing charges that she recruited women and girls, one as young as 14, for Epstein to sexually abuse.
item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell moved to notorious New York jail

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The office of Premier Gladys Berejiklian was told about a confidential offer to the City of Parramatta for funding from a community grants program to settle a legal dispute.
item.title: NSW government offered council grant funding to end legal action

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Data compiled by the Herald shows a swing of 76 penalties in favour of visiting sides while crowds were axed from NRL games.
item.title: Home truth for refs: Study shows huge penalty swing to away teams while crowds absent

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Users of a common health supplement have been increasingly experiencing loss of taste, leading some to wrongly believe they have COVID-19.
item.title: Side effect of common health supplement causes coronavirus concerns

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A plan to bring international students back to Queensland is almost ready as UQ urges the state government to make it known that Chinese students are welcome.
item.title: Plan to bring foreign students back to Queensland almost final

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: A policy to welcome Hong Kong’s high-quality talent will be inherently a self-interested one of national gain.
item.title: Australia set to join 'the greatest human capital harvest in recent memory'

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: A broader and higher GST would raise enough for states to ditch poor taxes but low income households would have to be properly compensated.
item.title: Bigger, broader GST could be offset by luxury taxes: PwC analysis

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Victorian Liberal Tim Wilson tops the list of MPs who spent a total of more than $400,000 on flags. And that's before we even get started on paper.
item.title: MPs fly the flag – and we pick up the tab

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The NSW-Victoria border will remain closed until the rising number of cases in Melbourne is brought under control.
item.title: 'Unprecedented': NSW-Victoria border closed by coronavirus with police on frontline

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, July 7

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Investor confidence in clean energy has bounced back, led by interest in NSW's new renewables zones, while the boom in solar rooftop installations shows little sign of tapering off.
item.title: Renewables confidence rises as solar boom shows no sign of fading

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Victoria's free TAFE program will be expanded, with 10,000 more places created in fields the Victorian government says will help the state recover from COVID-19.
item.title: 10,000 new free TAFE places funded as part of COVID-19 recovery plan

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Labor is calling on the Morrison government to urgently fund a $500,000 program to make sure Australians who don't speak English as a first language understand vital information during the coronavirus.
item.title: 'Confusion and misinformation': Labor wants more health translation services for multicultural communities

item.dc:creator: Andy Marks
item.description: Inner Sydney deemed that western Sydney – the country’s fastest growing and most culturally diverse region - could not be trusted as primary custodians of a bold new Powerhouse.
item.title: In Sydney's west we know all about getting a good haircut, and the Powerhouse backflip fits the bill

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Universities are for the first time offering students early entry based on their year 11 work from this year.
item.title: Early uni offers to target students disadvantaged by COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: The Boe Pahari debacle has brought renewed focus on the group but has an even bigger challenge.
item.title: Male Champions of Change has an image problem

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Viral video sharing platform TikTok is fighting back against calls for it to be banned in Australia amid data security concerns.
item.title: TikTok on thin ice as Parliament prepares to pore over app

item.description: With Victoria struggling to contain the COVID-19 outbreak over the past week, the NSW government should have closed the border sooner.
item.title: Premier should have acted sooner on Victorian border

item.dc:creator: Brian Toohey
item.description: The Morrison government keeps stressing that we share many common values with India but not China. This claim doesn’t square with reality.
item.title: Drop the pretence when it comes to India
